page.title: 05CHANGING TIMES-1925-1985
page.content: Today the area known as Solihull Lodge is mainly residential with its own shops and services.The houses are mainly semi-detached and detached,occupied by families with children of all ages. Before the Second World War this area was composed mainly of livestock farms(pigs)and open ground. There was some permanent housing along the main road but elsewhere there were temporary huts and caravans. There were a number of large farmhouses and smaller cottages. There were few shops and most supplies had to be bought in Solihull although most of the inhabitants were able to grow their own fruit and vegetables.Alongside the main road there was a site for barrage balloons used during the war years.Many of the area's roads have names recalling rural life.
